1814	1232495865000	 isaac.jones	Refactored the main intents in order to use permissions.Now, to use any of the intents: get/set encrypt/decrypt, you will needto declare use of a permission as follows:    &lt;uses-permission android:name=&quot;org.openintents.safe.ACCESS_INTENTS&quot; /&gt;I've made that change to TestSafe and Notepad.This required refactoring the FrontDoor.  Basically, I moved _all_ thefunctionality of FrontDoor to a new class: IntentHandler, and changedthe name of that class. Now FrontDoor basically only:    if (action == null || action.equals(Intent.ACTION_MAIN)){          Intent i = new Intent(getApplicationContext(),          IntentHandler.class);          startActivity(i);    }Now FrontDoor only handles those actions as above, and IntentHandlerhandles all the others, and includes the permission:   &lt;activity class=&quot;.IntentHandler&quot; android:name=&quot;IntentHandler&quot;android:label=&quot;@string/app_name&quot;              android:permission=&quot;org.openintents.safe.ACCESS_INTENTS&quot;&gt;Please see the OI Safe Manifest file for details.This was required because the launcher would need to use thatpermission if it protected ACTION_MAIN!  So now the launcher isallowed to run FrontDoor (which requires no permission) and FrontDoorruns IntentHandler.  Basically this goes around the permission in thecase of action MAIN. Modified : /trunk/NotePad/AndroidManifest.xml Modified : /trunk/Safe/AndroidManifest.xml Modified : /trunk/Safe/res/values/strings.xml Added : /trunk/Safe/src/org/openintents/safe/IntentHandler.java Modified : /trunk/UpdateChecker/src/org/openintents/updatechecker/Manifest.java Modified : /trunk/samples/TestSafe/AndroidManifest.xml 	Refactored the main intents in order to use permissions.Now, to use any of the intents: get/set encrypt/decrypt, you will needto declare use of a permission as follows:    &lt;uses-permission android:name=&quot;org.openintents.safe.ACCESS_INTENTS&quot; /&gt;I've made that change to TestSafe and Notepad.This required refactoring the FrontDoor.  Basically, I moved _all_ thefunctionality of FrontDoor to a new class: IntentHandler, and changedthe name of that class. Now FrontDoor basically only:    if (action == null || action.equals(Intent.ACTION_MAIN)){          Intent i = new Intent(getApplicationContext(),          IntentHandler.class);          startActivity(i);    }Now FrontDoor only handles those actions as above, and IntentHandlerhandles all the others, and includes the permission:   &lt;activity class=&quot;.IntentHandler&quot; android:name=&quot;IntentHandler&quot;android:label=&quot;@string/app_name&quot;              android:permission=&quot;org.openintents.safe.ACCESS_INTENTS&quot;&gt;Please see the OI Safe Manifest file for details.This was required because the launcher would need to use thatpermission if it protected ACTION_MAIN!  So now the launcher isallowed to run FrontDoor (which requires no permission) and FrontDoorruns IntentHandler.  Basically this goes around the permission in thecase of action MAIN.

1967	1236203760000	 rmceoin	OI Safe: moved almost all access of the database to a new class Passwords.This new class in turn interacts with DBHelper.   It retains allPassEntry and CategoryEntry data in memory.  Encrypted data is onlydecrypted as needed.   Decrypted data is kept in memory.  This servesas a cache and results in a dramatic increase in speed on theCategoryList and PassList activities upon repeat use.All references to DBHelper for passwords or categories have beenremoved from all activities and centralized inside of Passwords.  Theonly remaining DBHelper calls are for the Salt and MasterPassword.With this new class we should be able to more easily implement asearch activity.Fixed an assortment of minor flaws surround orientation changes.Possibly fixed I210.  Fixed I206 and I209.This is a major overhaul.  Please help test for new bugs.
